data.title: SUNDAY BRUNCH!!
data.text: Any other day of the week besides Sunday, you may walk past The Wine Dive bar and assume its an average restaurant but on sundays.... its a different story. I had the most fun I've ever had here for Sunday brunch!!! Bottomless pitchers of mimosas and bloody marys along with choices of breakfast foods with great music and upbeat atmosphere! I loved it!

data.title: Sunday bottomless Bloody Mary's !
data.text: Met friends and ended up have a great time, great food and a very fun time!  Amanda our server was the best. Thanks Amanda!  Our first time there and we will be back.

data.title: Brunch at The Wine Dive
data.text: I recently had brunch with a group of friends celebrating a birthday.  I have to say the food was excellent.  We all got something different.  I had the Canadian Bacon Eggs Benedict.  They have steak and eggs, quiche, chicken and waffles, flatbread, etc....  Most served with homemade roasted potatoes.  You can also ordered other items on the side.  We had Mirmosas at our brunch.

data.title: Not our kind of place
data.text:
It was loud. Service was terrible. Flatbread and salad were great. 

If you are into bottomless mimosas, this is the place for you.

data.title: Sunday Brunch, bottomless mimosa
data.text: This place has delicious food but i love the brunch. And bottomless mimosa and bloody mary's. Best way to spend a sunday morning. You must try the My Benedict and/or the French Toast. The wine list is average and predictable, that's the only disappointment. Service is good, attentive. Great place to go with a group of friends or a ladies night (or day).

data.title: Slow service
data.text: I visited this restaurant on a Saturday morning in a group of 7 women. I was surprised when the server told me they do not have hot tea. Who ever heard of a place that serves brunch that does not have tea bags? The service (Amanda) was very slow. We had to repeatedly ask for refills on coffee, etc. I kept trying to figure out why the service was bad as there were only 4 occupied tables... ??? I asked for ranch and was again told they did not have it. My omelet was good; the potatoes were average. Bad service really annoys me as I have been a server on and off for 20 years. If you are feeling overwhelmed, as your manager for help. If you take a long time to bring a drink refill, apologize. It makes a difference. Bad service is frequently a reflection of bad management. Next time I am downtown WPB, I will look for another place to have brunch 😞

data.title: Sunday Brunch Winner!
data.text: Met a few friends for Sunday Brunch this past Sunday. With Bottomless Mimosas and Bloody Marys it was the best. The DJ play all the top hits from the 90's till now. Our Waitress Sam was AWESOME! We had to call her back to tip her again. Yes that's right we tipped her for the brunch and then tipped her again after we left the table. Most wait staff just leaves after the check is paid. She didn't she stuck with us and kept refilling the Mimosas! We met her manager Anthony and was just as cool. Hat's off to the staff, Music, atmosphere and the beautiful people of Palm Beach. Can't wait to do this again.

data.title: Nice place to start
data.text: I like some of the wine selections but others such as cabs they shouldn't keep so cold as they sell glasses by sip, half glass etc and use the tap system. Nice food parings to match this is a good starting meeting place will be back

data.title: Delicious Food
data.text:
Food was amazing! Highly recommend the donut dessert with bacon. 
The atmosphere was very chill and perfect for a date night. Will be returning.

data.title: Get Your Swirl On
data.text: Went on a Wednesday at 5:00 pm.  With the exception of a party for one of our local judges retirement, the place was empty.  It's a shame, because it has a good vibe to it.  The decor is very retro-industrial, which I found very interesting.  Our waitress, Amanda, was honest, which I like.  My wife asked about the house Chardonnay, to which Amanda said, it's okay. My wife then asked, and I quote, "Will a picky b!tch (self proclaimed, LOL) like it?"  Amanda said no.  Truly appreciated the honesty, which you don't get everywhere.  Anyway, Tried a couple reds and a Chardonnay and they were pretty good.  Happy Hour Blue Point Oysters $1 each was a terrific find.  They were very juicy and large.  Totally awesome!  I will say the mignonette sauce was poor, but the cocktail sauce was very good.  Cheese board was outstanding!!  Slider of the day was great and tangy.  Falafel was good too - the hummus was fresh and delish, but some pita to dip in would have been nice.  Anyhoo, all in all.  Very enjoyable.  We'll be back.  Happy Dining!

data.title: Mother's Day FAIL
data.text:
We made reservations for mothers day 2 weeks ago for the family.

Restaurant called 545 Saturday night to confirm.  We were informed that no one under 21 was allowed in the restaurant.  Mothers day,  really?????

This would have been good information when we booked the table.

LOW CLASS.

DON'T GO THERE 

THAT.IS.ALL

data.title: Sophisticated Cocktails at the bar
data.text: Great cocktail menu. My friend and I sat at the bar and eally enjoyed the Cucumber and gin/elderflower/prosecco (can't remember the name) martini's. I told the bartender I really didn't want a sweet drink and the bartender made the drink perfectly. We split the Brie appetizer and it was inventive and yummy!

data.title: Great place for a yummy meal and amazing wine
data.text: We found ourselves on the famous Clematis Street looking for a place to eat.  I wanted fish but we weren't impressed with the Fish restaurant down the street.  We decided to try the Wine Dive on a whim and boy were we pleasantly surprised to find at not only did they have 1/2 price on bottles of wine (Wednesday evenings) but they also had some amazing fish dishes to choose from.  I chose the seared tuna on a bed of sautéed veggies.  The portions were huge and the food was perfectly cooked.  I will definitely go back the next time I'm in town!

data.title: Best kept secret on Clematis!!!
data.text: My wife and I love this restaurant! Great food and wine and the staff are very friendly and easy going. I'm not sure why this place isn't packed out.

data.title: Brunch
data.text:
By 1130 it was packed. Food was good, prices reasonable. Favorites were the chicken and waffle (the red velvet waffle was eh) and pepper mill gravy. Cheese grits were a fail for me but others enjoyed them--I thought they were bland. $10 bottomless mimosas til 1pm pretty great. Service was okay--friendly but on the slow side.

Would return if in the area. Overall this was a three star spot for me but the outstanding corned beef hash warranted an additional one.

data.title: Woah!
data.text: Sunday brunch.... was not expecting Miami night club vibes but I loved it! If you want the best breakfast food, and consistently flowing mimosas severed by the most attractive staff ever please go here for this experience. DO NOT MAKE PLANS TO DO ANYTHING PRODUCTIVE AFTER! In all honesty if you want to talk to the people you are with or have room to breath you should not go here on a Sunday morning. But if you want to party and have Sunday Funday this is the place for you!

data.title: Thought it would get Better!
data.text: The hostess were not very friendly.  There were 20 people in our group with one waiter Brian.  The guy that was bringing out water spilled water over three of our group including me.  I do not know what was in the water or maybe on the table, but it left a large stain in my dress.  The food took another 45 minutes to come out.  We went for Sunday Brunch.  They would bring out the small plate with your eggs and 10-15 minutes later you received the rest of your meal.  Food not good at all.  I hate writing bad reviews, however, it would not be fair to the readers to say anything good about this restaurant.  I did speak with the manager, Anthony, however, not satisfied with response.

data.title: Great Brunch Spot
data.text: This place gets crazy packed for Sunday Brunch. Make sure to make reservations or else you may never even get a table. The Bottomless mimosas are a great deal you can either spend $10 for bottomless till 1pm, or $20 for bottomless till 3pm. IT all depends when you get there and how long you plan to stay. The music that they play brings you back to the 9, its fantastic. One of the best brunch spots you can go to in West Palm. They updated the Menu since I was there last and the new breakfast tacos were fantastic.

data.title: Great place to start the evening!
data.text: Great bar to start the evening with a few pre dinner drinks. The staff were friendly and the drinks were good. They served food but we didn't eat there. Great atmosphere!

data.title: Wide selection, Great service
data.text: My wife and I have been here a few times on previous trips to West Palm Beach, and this year was perhaps the best of nothing but good experiences. Elijah was a delightful server--fun, knowledgeable and articulate about the questions we had the various wines we ordered. We asked for some recommendations in specific categories and he always delivered. We came back again and had a similar positive and delightful experience with another server...I think Stephanie was her name. The setting is steam-punkishly beautiful--lots of raw brick and interesting light fixtures. Have had a couple of the small plate items and all were quite good. Especially loved the blue point oysters.
